page.title: 12 BODY-POPPING
page.content: At weekends and in the evenings many young people spend their time moving to music in a way called{body-popping. We put flat cardboard boxes on the pavement and play a special kind of music on tape recorders which we call "Rasta-Blasters". Here is how you do some of the moves.{LOCKING}you make quick moves and have a short pause in between.{BACKWALK}where you walk backwards sliding your toes and raising your heels alternately.{ {BROOMWALK}this is like the Backwalk but you move round in a circle. {HEARTBEAT}you move your hands palms inwards, to cross your heart, then push your chest out.{EGYPTIAN}to do this you move like an eastern dancer only jerkily. Most body-popping moves you do standing up, but you can kneel down in some moves too.
